text: Aalesunds blad (The Ålesund Gazette) was a newspaper published in Ålesund, Norway between 1871 and 1895.Høeg, Tom Arbo. 1974. Norske aviser: Registerbind. Oslo: Universitetsbibliotekets Hustrykkeri, p. 79. The newspaper was politically conservative. In its first years, the editorial board consisted of the merchant Frants Mathias Olsen and printer Klaus Emil Fjelde, assisted by the lawyers Peter Anton Devold and Hans Anton Staboe Schjølberg. Responsibility was eventually taken over by the telegraph director Edvard Endresen.Bugge, Kristian. 1923. Aalesunds historie: Utgit av Aalesunds kommune i anledning av byens 75 års jubilaeum. Aalesund, p. 210. In 1896, the paper changed its name to Søndmøre Folketidende. ==References== Category:Defunct newspapers published in Norway Category:Norwegian-language newspapers Category:Mass media in Møre og Romsdal Category:Ålesund Category:Publications established in 1871 Category:Publications disestablished in 1895
title: Aalesunds blad
